title: Lorry death inquiry switches to Vietnam as cops obtain blood and hair samples from victims' relatives
text:
Police in Vietnam on Sunday began the task of taking blood, hair and finger nail samples from relatives of suspected victims of the Essex lorry trailer horror as it emerged that at least 24 of the 39 killed came from just two provinces.

The DNA obtained from the families will be used to confirm the identities of the people who died in the back of a refrigerated lorry that had brought them to the UK from Zeebrugge in Belgium.

The bodies were discovered in Grays in Essex just before 2am on October 23. Inquiries are concentrating on two neighbouring provinces of central Vietnam - Nghe An and Ha Tinh - from where it is now believed the majority of the victims had travelled.
